description: The ESV Bible is an essentially literal translation that seeks to reproduce the precise wording of the original text and the personal style of each Bible writer.

translationPhilosophy.summary: An 'essentially literal' translation emphasizing word-for-word correspondence while taking full account of differences in grammar, syntax, and idiom between current literary English and the original languages.
characteristics: Seeks to reproduce the precise wording of the original text
Maintains the personal style of each Bible writer
Transparent to the original text structure and force
Captures echoes and overtones of meaning in original texts
Uses same English word for important recurring words in original
Renders Old Testament passages cited in New Testament to show correspondence
Balances literal precision with readability and literary excellence
strengths: Suitable for public reading and preaching
translationPhilosophy.team: More than 100 leading evangelical scholars and pastors

description: The NET Bible is a completely new translation with 60,000+ translator's notes, completed by 25+ scholars working directly from the best available Hebrew, Aramaic, and Greek texts.

translationPhilosophy.summary: A balanced translation that overcomes the tension between accuracy and readability, combining faithful rendering of original languages with clear, contemporary English.
characteristics: Faithful to the original biblical languages
Notes explain difficult or nontraditional renderings
Ongoing revisions based on scholarly and user feedback
strengths: Accessible to both academic and general readers
Shows complex linguistic details without sacrificing clarity
Invites readers into the translation process
translationPhilosophy.team: Multi-denominational team of 25+ leading biblical scholars
